citation.article-title: Natroniella acetigena gen. nov. sp. nov., an Extremely Haloalkaliphilic, Homoacetic Bacterium: A New Member of Haloanaerobiales

p.s: Natroniella (Na.tro.ni.ella. From Latin natron—sodium carbonate Na2CO3—organism, growing in soda deposits)
Gram-negative, spore-forming rods, motile by peritrichous flagella.
Haloanaerobes which perform homoacetic fermentation of a restricted number of compounds.
Low mol% G + C content of the DNA.
Belongs to the mainly sporeforming branch of the order Haloanaerobiales, the family Halobacteroidaceae.
Monotypic with the type species Natroniella acetigena.
